FuncDef:
The if-match tcp-flag command configures a matching rule based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header in a traffic classifier.
The undo if-match tcp-flag command deletes a matching rule based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header in a traffic classifier. The if-match tcp-flag command configures a matching rule based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header in a traffic classifier. The undo if-match tcp-flag command deletes a matching rule based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header in a traffic classifier. By default, a matching rule based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header is not configured in a traffic classifier.
CLIs: if-match tcp-flag { <tcp-flag-value> | { ack | fin | psh | rst | syn | urg } }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of the TCP flag in the TCP packet header.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.

Indicates that the TCP Flag type in the TCP packet header is ACK.
-

Indicates that the TCP flag type in the TCP packet header is FIN.
-

Indicates that the TCP Flag type in the TCP packet header is PSH.
-

Indicates that the TCP flag type in the TCP packet header is RST.
-

Indicates that the TCP Flag type in the TCP packet header is SYN.
-

Indicates that the TCP Flag type in the TCP packet header is URG.
-

ExtraInfo: You can run the if-match tcp-flag command to classify packets based on the TCP Flag in the TCP packet header so that the device processes packets matching the same traffic classifier in the same manner.
